sentences.cn: 所有那些削尖脑袋向上爬的可耻行径！

sentences.en: Altogether seven inmates escaped by scaling a wall and climbing down scaffolding.
sentences.cn: 总共有7名犯人攀墙从脚手架上爬下来逃走了。

sentences.en: Climbing so high made me feel dizzy .
sentences.cn: 爬那么高使我感到头晕目眩。

sentences.en: Climbing these stairs takes all the wind out of him.
He fell behind when we were climbing the mountain.
He goes climbing nearly every weekend.
sentences.cn: 他几乎每个周末都去登山。

sentences.en: He made a bid for freedom by climbing over the wall.
sentences.cn: 他企图翻越这面高墙以获得自由.

sentences.en: He was wearing shoes that were totally unsuitable for climbing.
sentences.cn: 他穿了一双完全不适合登山的鞋子。

sentences.en: His sporting and political interests coalesced admirably in his writing about climbing.
sentences.cn: 他在写登山的文章中，把自己对体育和政治的兴趣完美地结合了起来。

sentences.en: I told her about him climbing up the drainpipe.
sentences.cn: 我对她讲了他从排水管爬上去的事儿.

sentences.en: The man glanced the burglar climbing out of the window.
sentences.cn: 那人瞥见小偷从窗户爬出来.

sentences.en: The nation's unemployment rate has been climbing steadily since last June.
sentences.cn: 自去年6月以来，该国的失业率一直在不断上升。

sentences.en: They were climbing up a narrow mountain road.
sentences.cn: 他们正沿一条狭窄的山路向上爬。

sentences.en: While climbing up the stairs the old man always loses his breath.
sentences.cn: 那老人上楼时总是气喘吁吁的.

words.tran_cn: 登山者；攀缘植物；尽力改善自己社会地位的人

phrases.tran_cn: 藤蔓植物；攀缘植物；攀绿植物

trans.tran_en: the sport of climbing mountains or rocks

trans.tran_cn: 爬( climb的现在分词)，攀登，（尤指吃力地向某处）爬，登山
